content.rendered:
4 September 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues to expand its international footprint and opens a new office in Doha, Qatar.

AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has opened 16 offices in 11 countries worldwide since its establishment just over two years ago. In the Middle East, AqualisBraemar has offices in Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, UAE (Dubai and Abu Dhabi), and now also Qatar.

“National oil companies, independents and rig owners operating out of Qatar have asked us to support them with both engineering and oilfield services projects. We want to provide them with the highest possible level of service, so it makes perfect sense to have a permanent presence in Qatar,” says Reuben Segal, director – Middle East, AqualisBraemar.

Segal highlights field installations, engineering design, engineering warranty, construction supervision, marine warranty services and rig moving for jack-ups as the Doha office’s main lines of work.

AqualisBraemar is a specialised marine and offshore engineering consultancy focusing on the shallow and deep-water segments of the offshore oil, gas and wind industries.

excerpt.rendered: 4 September 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues to expand its international footprint and opens a new office in Doha, Qatar.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar appoints Qatar head
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 7 June 2018 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Mark McNeil Cassidy as country manager in Qatar. Mark McNeil Cassidy is a master mariner with 31 years’ seagoing experience, 24 years of which have been in the offshore oil and gas industry and five years in shore-based…

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar opens office in Abu Dhabi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 19 February 2014 – New offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues its expansion in the Middle East and opens an office in Abu Dhabi. Just nine months after starting operations in the Middle East, AqualisBraemar has established offices in Dubai, UAE (regional headquarters); Dammam, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Bahrain;…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar sets up office in Australia
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has set up an office in Perth, Western Australia, to support oil and gas developments in the Australasia region.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Meet the Team: Pradeep Padman
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “As a Lead Naval Architect based in Dubai office, I look after the Engineering and Marine Warranty Services in the Middle East region.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar to South Korea
